meanings.definition: In the direction that one is facing or traveling.
meanings.sent1: She walked forwards towards the park.
meanings.sent2: The car moved forwards slowly in traffic.
meanings.sent3: The dog chased its tail forwards in circles.
meanings.sent4: Time always moves forwards, never backward.
meanings.sent5: The arrow pointed forwards, guiding the way.

meanings.sent1: He leaned forwards to get a better view.
meanings.sent2: The students moved forwards in line for lunch.
meanings.sent3: The wind pushed the sailboat forwards swiftly.
meanings.sent4: The team surged forwards towards victory.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower turned forwards, seeking the sun's warmth.

meanings.sent1: She planned forwards for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent2: The company prepared forwards for the new product launch.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored nuts forwards for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The astronaut trained forwards for the space mission.
meanings.sent5: The chef cooked forwards, anticipating the dinner rush.

meanings.sent1: The train moved forwards along the tracks.
meanings.sent2: The river flowed forwards towards the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The story unfolded forwards, revealing its secrets.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner pressed forwards towards the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The clock ticked forwards, marking each passing second.

meanings.definition: In support of or in favor of.
meanings.sent1: She stood forwards her friend during the difficult times.
meanings.sent2: The community rallied forwards the new library project.
meanings.sent3: The team cheered forwards their captain's decision.
meanings.sent4: He voted forwards the proposal in the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The crowd moved forwards the speaker, eager to hear more.
